S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureCatalogue.S100FC:name: S-201 AtoN
S100FC:S100_FC_FeatureCatalogue.S100FC:scope: Ocean, Coastal, Ports, Harbors and Inland waters

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Administrative division
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Administrative division is a generic term for an administrative region within a country at a level below that of the sovereign state.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Aid availability category
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A Category denoting the significance of an Aid to Navigation, expressed in terms of the probability that an AtoN or system of AtoN, as defined by the Competent Authority, is performing its specified function at any randomly chosen time. This is expressed as a percentage of total time that an AtoN or system of AtoN should be performing their specified function.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Category 1
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An AtoN or system of AtoN that is considered by the Competent Authority to be of vital navigational significance.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Category 2
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An AtoN or system of AtoN that is considered by the Competent Authority to be of important navigational significance.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: Category 3
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: An AtoN or system of AtoN that is considered by the Competent Authority to be of necessary navigational significance.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: AtoN maintenance record
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A reference following the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) principles to a record of maintenance.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Beacon shape
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The shape a beacon exhibits

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: stake, pole, perch, post
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an elongated wood or metal pole, embedded in the bottom to serve as a navigational aid or a support for a navigational aid.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: withy
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a tree without roots stuck or spoiled into the bottom of the sea to serve as a navigational aid.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: beacon tower
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a solid structure of the order of 10 metres in height used as a navigational aid.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: lattice beacon
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a structure consisting of strips of metal or wood crossed or interlaced to form a structure to serve as an aid to navigation or as a support for an aid to navigation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pile beacon
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a long heavy timber(s) or section(s) of steel, wood, concrete, etc., forced into the seabed to serve as an aid to navigation or as a support for an aid to navigation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cairn
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mound of stones, usually conical or pyramidal, raised specifically for maritime navigation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: buoyant beacon
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a tall spar-like beacon fitted with a permanently submerged buoyancy chamber, the lower end of the body is secured to seabed sinker either by a flexible joint or by a cable under tension.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Building shape
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The specific shape of the building.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: high-rise building
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a building having many storeys.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pyramid
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a polyhedron of which one face is a polygon of any number of sides, and the other faces are triangles with a common vertex.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cylindrical
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: shaped like a cylinder, which is a solid geometrical figure generated by straight lines fixed in direction and describing with one of its points a closed curve, especially a circle.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: spherical
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: shaped like a sphere, which is a body the surface of which is at all points equidistant from the centre.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cubic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a shape the sides of which are six equal squares a regular hexahedron.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Buoy shape
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The shape a buoy exhibits
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The principal shapes are those recommended in the International Association of Lighthouse Authorities - IALA System.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: conical (nun, ogival)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure, has approximately the shape or the appearance of a pointed cone with the point upwards.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: can (cylindrical)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure, has the shape of a cylinder, or a truncated cone that approximates to a cylinder, with a flat end uppermost.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: spherical
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure, has the shape of a part of a sphere.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pillar
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure is a narrow vertical structure, pillar or lattice tower.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: spar (spindle)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure, has the form of a pole, or of a very long cylinder, floating upright.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: barrel (tun)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure, has the form of a barrel or cylinder floating horizontally.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: super-buoy
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a very large buoy, generally more than 5m in diameter.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ice buoy
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a specially constructed shuttle shaped buoy which is used in ice conditions.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of aggregation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Named aggregations between two or more aids to navigation and/or navigationally relevant features.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Open enumeration codelist

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: leading line
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A line passing through two or more clearly defined charted objects, and along which a vessel can approach safely.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: range system
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Two or more objects in line. Such objects are said to be in range. An observer having them in range is said to be on the range.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: measured distance
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A course at sea, whose ends are indicated by ranges ashore, and whose length has been accurately measured for determining the speed of vessels.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of association
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Named associations between two or more aids to navigation and/or navigationally relevant features.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Open enumeration codelist

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: channel markings
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A group of channel marks which indicate channel limits

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: danger markings
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: One or more aids to navigation and the danger(s) they mark

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of cardinal mark
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Cardinal marks are classified according to the quadrant of space they occupy.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Cardinal marks are used in conjunction with the compass to indicate where a mariner will find safe navigable water. Cardinal marks do not have a distinctive shape but are normally pillar or spar. They are always painted in yellow and black horizontal bands and their distinctive double cone top-marks are always black. (Note that such top-marks are encoded as separate TOPMAR objects). Cardinal marks may also have a special system of flashing white lights and if such lights are fitted they are encoded as separate LIGHTS objects.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: north cardinal mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Quadrant bounded by the true bearing NW-NE taken from the point of interest it should be passed to the north side of the mark.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: east cardinal mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Quadrant bounded by the true bearing NE-SE taken from the point of interest it should be passed to the east side of the mark.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: south cardinal mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Quadrant bounded by the true bearing SE-SW taken from the point of interest it should be passed to the south side of the mark.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: west cardinal mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Quadrant bounded by the true bearing SW-NW taken from the point of interest it should be passed to the west side of the mark.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of fog signal
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of the various means of generating the fog signal.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The classification 'horn' is the generic term for fog signals 'nautophone', 'reed' and 'tyfon'.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: explosive
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal produced by the firing of explosive charges.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: diaphone
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a diaphone uses compressed air and generally emits a powerful low-pitched sound, which often concludes with a brief sound of suddenly lowered pitch, termed the 'grunt'.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: siren
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a siren uses compressed air and exists in a variety of types which differ considerably in their sound and power.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: nautophone
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a horn having a diaphragm oscillated by electricity

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a reed uses compressed air and emits a weak, high pitched sound.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tyfon
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a diaphragm horn which operates under the influence of compressed air or steam

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bell
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a ringing sound with a short range.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: whistle
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a distinctive sound made by a jet of air passing through an orifice.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: gong
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a sound produced by vibration of a disc when struck.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: horn
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a horn uses compressed air or electricity to vibrate a diaphragm and exists in a variety of types which differ greatly in their sound and power.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of installation buoy
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of fixed installation buoy

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: catenary anchor leg mooring (CALM)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: incorporates a large buoy which remains on the surface at all times and is moored by 4 or more anchors. Mooring hawsers and cargo hoses lead from a turntable on top of the buoy, so that the buoy does not turn as the ship swings to wind and stream.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: single buoy mooring (SBM)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mooring structure used by tankers to load and unload in port approaches or in offshore oil and gas fields. The size of the structure can vary between a large mooring buoy and a manned floating structure. Also known as single point mooring (SPM)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of landmark
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of prominent cultural and natural features in the landscape

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cairn
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mound of stones, usually conical or pyramidal, raised as a landmark or to designate a point of importance in surveying.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cemetery
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area of land for burying the dead.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: chimney
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vertical structure containing a passage or flue for discharging smoke and gases.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dish aerial
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a parabolic aerial for the receipt and transmission of high frequency radio signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: flagstaff (flagpole)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a staff or pole on which flags are raised.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: flare stack
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a tall structure used for burning-off waste oil or gas. Normally showing a flame and located at refineries.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mast
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a straight vertical piece of timber or a hollow cylinder.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: wind sock
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a tapered fabric sleeve mounted so as to catch and swing with the wind, thus indicating the wind direction.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: monument
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a structure erected or maintained as a memorial to a person or event.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: column (pillar)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a cylindrical or slightly tapering body of considerably greater length than diameter erected vertically.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: memorial plaque
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a slab of metal, usually ornamented, erected as a memorial to a person or event.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: obelisk
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a tapering shaft usually of stone or concrete, square or rectangular in section, with a pyramidal apex.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: statue
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a representation of a human, animal or fantasy figure in marble, bronze, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cross
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a monument, or other structure in form of a cross.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: dome
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a landmark comprising a hemispherical or spheroidal shaped structure

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: radar scanner
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a device used for directing a radar beam through a search pattern

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tower
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a relatively tall structure which may be used for observation, support, storage or communication etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: windmill
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a wind driven system of vanes attached to a tower like structure (excluding wind-generated power plants).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: windmotor
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a modern structure for the use of windpower.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: spire/minaret
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a tall conical or pyramid-shaped structure often built on the roof or tower of a building, especially a church or mosque.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: large rock or boulder on land
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an isolated rocky formation or a single large stone

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of lateral mark
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of lateral buoys
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: There are two international buoyage regions, A and B, between which lateral marks differ. The buoyage region is encoded using the separate attribute MARSYS. When top-marks, retro reflectors and/or lights are fitted to these marks, they are encoded as separate objects.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: port-hand lateral mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: indicates the port boundary of a navigational channel or suggested route when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage'.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: starboard-hand lateral mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: indicates the starboard boundary of a navigational channel or suggested route when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage'.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: preferred channel to starboard lateral mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: at a point where a channel divides, when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage', the preferred channel (or primary route) is indicated by a modified port-hand lateral mark.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: preferred channel to port lateral mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: at a point where a channel divides, when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage', the preferred channel (or primary route) is indicated by a modified starboard-hand lateral mark.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of light
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of different light types
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Marine light (a light intended primarily for marine navigation) is not included in the above list. All lights are considered to be marine lights unless the attribute 'category of light' indicates otherwise.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: directional function
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light illuminating a sector of very narrow angle and intended to mark a direction to follow.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: leading light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light associated with other lights so as to form a leading line to be followed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: aero light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an aero light is established for aeronautical navigation and may be of higher power than marine lights and visible from well offshore.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: air obstruction light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light marking an obstacle which constitutes a danger to air navigation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fog detector light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light used to automatically determine conditions of visibility which warrant the turning on or off of a sound signal.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: flood light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a broad beam light used to illuminate a structure or area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: strip light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light whose source has a linear form generally horizontal, which can reach a length of several metres.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: subsidiary light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light placed on or near the support of a main light and having a special use in navigation.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: spotlight
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a powerful light focused so as to illuminate a small area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: front
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: term used with leading lights to describe the position of the light on the lead as viewed from seaward.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: rear
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: term used with leading lights to describe the position of the light on the lead as viewed from seaward.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: lower
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: term used with leading lights to describe the position of the light on the lead as viewed from seaward.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: upper
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: term used with leading lights to describe the position of the light on the lead as viewed from seaward.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: moire effect
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a short range (up to 2km) type of directional light. Sodium lighting gives a yellow background to a screen on which a vertical black line will be seen by an observer on the centre line.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: emergency
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light available as a backup to a main light which will be illuminated should the main light fail.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bearing light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light which enables its approximate bearing to be obtained without the use of a compass.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: horizontally disposed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a group of lights of identical character and almost identical position, that are disposed horizontally.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: vertically disposed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a group of lights of identical character and almost identical position, that are disposed vertically.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of navigation line
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of route guidance given to vessels

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: clearing line
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a straight line that marks the boundary between a safe and a dangerous area or that passes clear of a navigational danger.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: transit line
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a line passing through one or more fixed marks.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: leading line bearing a recommended track
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a line passing through one or more clearly defined objects, along the path of which a vessel can approach safely up to a certain distance off.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of offshore platform
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of an offshore raised structure

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: oil derrick/rig
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a temporary mobile structure, either fixed or floating, used in the exploration stages of oil and gas fields.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: production platform
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a term used to indicate a permanent offshore structure equipped to control the flow of oil or gas. It does not include entirely submarine structures.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: observation/research platform
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a platform from which one's surroundings or events can be observed, noted or recorded such as for scientific study.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: articulated loading platform (ALP)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a metal lattice tower, buoyant at one end and attached at the other by a universal joint to a concrete filled base on the sea bed. The platform may be fitted with a helicopter platform, emergency accommodation and hawser/hose retrieval.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: single anchor leg mooring (SALM)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a rigid frame or tube with a buoyancy device at its upper end , secured at its lower end to a universal joint on a large steel or concrete base resting on the sea bed, and at its upper end to a mooring buoy by a chain or wire.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mooring tower
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a platform secured to the sea bed and surmounted by a turntable to which ships moor.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: artificial island
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a man-made structure usually built for the exploration or exploitation of marine resources, marine scientific research, tidal observations, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: floating production, storage and offloading vessel (FPSO)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an offshore oil/gas facility consisting of a moored tanker/barge by which the product is extracted, stored and exported.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: accommodation platform
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a platform used primarily for eating, sleeping and recreation purposes.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: navigation, communication and control buoy (NCCB)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a floating structure with control room, power and storage facilities, attached to the sea bed by a flexible pipeline and cables.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of pile
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of pile, driven into the earth as a foundation or support for a structure

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: stake
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an elongated wood or metal pole embedded in the bottom to serve as a marker or support.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: post
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a vertical piece of timber, metal or concrete forced into the earth or sea bed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tripodal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a single structure comprising 3 or more piles held together (sections of heavy timber, steel or concrete), and forced into the earth or sea bed.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of radar transponder beacon
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of radar transponder beacon based on fuctionality.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ramark, radar beacon transmitting continuously
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a radar marker beacon which continuously transmits a signal appearing as a radial line on a radar screen, the line indicating the direction of the beacon. Ramarks are intended primarily for marine use. The name 'ramark' is derived from the words radar marker.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: racon, radar transponder beacon
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a radar beacon which returns a coded signal which provides identification of the beacon, as well as range and bearing. The range and bearing are indicated by the location of the first character received on the radar screen. The name 'racon' is derived from the words radar beacon.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: leading racon/radar transponder beacon
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a radar beacon that may be used (in conjunction with at least one other radar beacon) to indicate a leading line.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of recommended track
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of track based on defining navigational marks

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: based on a system of fixed marks
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a straight route (known as a recommended track, range or leading line), which comprises at least two structures (usually beacons or daymarks) and/or natural features, which may carry lights and/or top-marks. The structures/features are positioned so that when observed to be in line, a vessel can follow a known bearing with safety.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not based on a system of fixed marks
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a route (known as a recommended track or preferred route) which is not based on a series of structures or features in line.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of silo/tank
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification based on the product

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: silo in general
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a generally cylindrical tower used for storing fodder or grain.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: tank in general
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a fixed structure for storing liquids.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: grain elevator
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a storage building for grain. Usually a tall frame, metal or concrete structure with an especially compartmented interior.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: water tower
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a tower with an elevated container used to hold water.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of special purpose mark
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification of an aid to navigation which signifies some special purpose
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: A mark may be a beacon, a buoy, a signpost or may take another form. NOTE: IALA added enumerate(s), code will need to be verified after approval for GI rgistry.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: firing danger mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark used to indicate a firing danger area, usually at sea.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: target mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: any object toward which something is directed. The distinctive marking or instrumentation of a ground point to aid its identification on a photograph.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: marker ship mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark marking the position of a ship which is used as a target during some military exercise.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: degaussing range mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark used to indicate a degaussing range.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: barge mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark of relevance to barges.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cable mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark used to indicate the position of submarine cables or the point at which they run on to the land.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: spoil ground mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark used to indicate the limit of a spoil ground

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: outfall mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark used to indicate the position of an outfall or the point at which it leaves the land.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ODAS
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Ocean Data Acquisition System

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: recording mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark used to record data for scientific purposes.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: seaplane anchorage mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark used to indicate a seaplane anchorage.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: recreation zone mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark used to indicate a recreation zone.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: private mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a privately maintained mark.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mooring mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating a mooring or moorings.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: LANBY
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a large buoy designed to take the place of a lightship where construction of an offshore light station is not feasible.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: leading mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: aids to navigation or other indicators so located as to indicate the path to be followed. Leading marks identify a leading line when they are in transit.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: measured distance mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark forming part of a transit indicating one end of a measured distance.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: notice mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a notice board or sign indicating information to the mariner.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: TSS mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating a traffic separation scheme.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: anchoring prohibited mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating an anchoring prohibited area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: berthing prohibited mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that berthing is prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: overtaking prohibited mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that overtaking is prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: two-way traffic prohibited mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating a one-way route.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: "reduced wake" mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that vessels must not generate excessive wake.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: speed limit mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that a speed limit applies.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: stop mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating the place where the bow of a ship must stop when traffic lights show red.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: general warning mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that special caution must be exercised in the vicinity of the mark.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: "sound ships siren" mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that a ship should sound its siren or horn.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: restricted vertical clearance mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating the minimum vertical space available for passage.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: maximum vessel's draught mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating the maximum draught of vessel permitted.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: restricted horizontal clearance mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating the minimum horizontal space available for passage.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: strong current warning mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark warning of strong currents.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: berthing permitted mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that berthing is allowed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: overhead power cable mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating an overhead power cable.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: "channel edge gradient" mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating the gradient of the slope of a dredge channel edge.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: telephone mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating the presence of a telephone.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ferry crossing mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that a ferry route crosses the ship route often used with a 'sound ship's siren' mark.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pipeline mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark used to indicate the position of submarine pipelines or the point at which they run on to the land.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: anchorage mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating an anchorage area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: clearing mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark used to indicate a clearing line.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: control mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating the location at which a restriction or requirement exists.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: diving mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that diving may take place in the vicinity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: refuge beacon
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark providing or indicating a place of safety.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: foul ground mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating a foul ground.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: yachting mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark installed for use by yachtsmen.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: heliport mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating an area where helicopters may land.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: GNSS mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating a location at which a GNSS position has been accurately determined.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: seaplane landing mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating an area where sea-planes land.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: entry prohibited mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that entry is prohibited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: work in progress mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating that work (generally construction) is in progress.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mark with unknown purpose
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark whose detailed characteristics are unknown.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: wellhead mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating a borehole that produces or is capable of producing oil or natural gas.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: channel separation mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating the point at which a channel divides separately into two channels.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: marine farm mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating the existence of a fish, mussel, oyster or pearl farm/ culture.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: artificial reef mark
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mark indicating the existence or the extent of an artificial reef.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: jetski prohibited
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A mark indicating a jetski prohibited area

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Category of temporal variation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An assessment of the likelihood of change within an area since last survey.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unassessed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Temporal variation not assessed or cannot be determined.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: event
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: No new hydrographic survey conducted after an event (e.g. hurricane, earthquake, volcanic eruption, landslide, etc), which is considered likely to have changed the seafloor significantly.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: likely to change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Continuous or frequent change (e.g. river siltation, sand waves, seasonal storms, icebergs, etc).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: likely to change but significant shoaling unlikely
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Likely to change but significant shoaling unlikely

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unlikely to change
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Significant change to the seafloor is not expected.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: City name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a town or city.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Colour
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The property possessed by an object of producing different sensations on the eye as a result of the way it reflects or emits light.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Colour pattern
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A regular repeated design containing more than one colour
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: NOTE: IALA added listed values. The codes will have to verified when submitting the new listed values to the GI registry.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: horizontal stripes
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: straight bands or stripes of differing colours painted horizontally.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: vertical stripes
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: straight bands or stripes of differing colours painted vertically.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: diagonal stripes
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: straight bands or stripes of differing colours painted diagonally (ie not horizontally or vertically).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: squared
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: often referred to as checker plate, where alternate colours are used to create squares similar to a chess or draught board. The pattern may be straight or diagonal.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: stripes (direction unknown)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: straight bands or stripes of differing colours painted in an unknown direction.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: border stripe
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a band or stripe of colour which is displayed around the outer edge of the object, which may also form a border to an inner pattern or plain colour.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: single colour
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: One solid colour of uniform coverage

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: rectangle
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: A four-sided shape that is made up of two pairs of parallel lines and that has four right angles, on a different coloured background

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: triangle
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a shape that is made up of three lines and three angles, on a different coloured background

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Condition
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The various conditions of buildings and other constructions.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The default 'condition' should be considered to be completed, undamaged and working normally. This attribute should, therefore, only be used to indicate objects whose condition is anything other than 'normal'.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: under construction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a structure that is in the process of being built.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ruined
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a structure in a decayed or deteriorated condition resulting from neglect or disuse, or a damaged structure in need of repair.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: under reclamation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area of the sea that is being reclaimed as land, usually by the dumping of earth and other material.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: wingless
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a windmill or windmotor from which the turbine blades are missing.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: planned construction
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an area where a future construction is planned.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Country
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The name of a nation. (Adapted from The American Heritage Dictionaries)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date end
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The latest date on which an object (e.g., a buoy) will be present.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This attribute is to be used to indicate the removal or cancellation of an object at a specific date in the future. See also 'periodic date end' (PEREND).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Date start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The earliest date on which an object (e.g., a buoy) will be present.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This attribute is to be used to indicate the deployment or implementation of an object at a specific date in the future. See also 'periodic date start' (PERSTA).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Delivery point
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Details of where post can be delivered such as the apartment, name and/or number of a street, building or PO Box.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Depth range value 2
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The maximum (deepest) value of a depth range.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Where the area dries, the value is negative. The unit of measure is defined in the DUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the DUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 fm or 0.1 ft.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Depth range value 1
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minimum (shoalest) value of a depth range.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Where the area dries, the value is negative. The unit of measure is defined in the DUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the DUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 fm or 0.1 ft.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Direction uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a bearing.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Elevation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The altitude of the ground level of an object, measured from a specified vertical datum.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Exhibition condition of light
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The outward display of the light

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: light shown without change of character
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light shown throughout the 24 hours without change of character.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: daytime light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light which is only exhibited by day.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fog light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light which is exhibited in fog or conditions of reduced visibility.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: night light
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light which is only exhibited at night.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Function
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A specific role that describes a feature

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: harbour-master's office
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the office of the local official who has charge of mooring and berthing of vessels, collecting harbour fees, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: customs office
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an office which is charged with enforcing customs regulations.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: health office
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the office which is charged with the administration of health laws and sanitary inspections.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: hospital
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an institution or establishment providing medical or surgical treatment for the ill or wounded.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: post office
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the public department, agency or organisation responsible primarily for the collection, transmission and distribution of mail.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: hotel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an establishment, especially of a comfortable or luxurious kind, where paying visitors are provided with accommodation, meals and other services.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: railway station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a building with platforms where trains arrive, load, discharge and depart.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: police station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the office of the local police force.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: water-police station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the headquarters of a local water-police force.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pilot office
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the office or headquarters of pilots the place where the services of a pilot may be obtained.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pilot lookout
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a distinctive structure on shore from which personnel keep watch upon events at sea or along the coast.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bank office
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an office for custody, deposit, loan, exchange or issue of money.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: headquarters for district control
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the quarters of an executive officer (director, manager, etc.) with responsibility for an administrative area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: transit shed/warehouse
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a building or part of a building for storage of wares or goods.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: factory
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a building or buildings with equipment for manufacturing a workshop.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: power station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a stationary plant containing apparatus for large scale conversion of some form of energy (such as hydraulic, steam, chemical or nuclear energy) into electrical energy.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: administrative
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a building for the management of affairs.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: educational facility
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a building concerned with education (e.g. school, college, university, etc.)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: church
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a building for public Christian worship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: chapel
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a place for Christian worship other than a parish, cathedral or church, especially one attached to a private house or institution.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: temple
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a building for public Jewish worship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: pagoda
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a Hindu or Buddhist temple or sacred building.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: shinto shrine
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a building for public Shinto worship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: buddhist temple
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: see pagoda.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: mosque
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a Muslim place of worship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: marabout
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a shrine marking the burial place of a Muslim holy man.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: lookout
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: keeping a watch upon events at sea or along the coast.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: communication
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: transmitting and/or receiving electronic communication signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: television
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast of television signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: radio
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcast of radio signals.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: radar
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a method, system or technique of using beamed, reflected, and timed radio waves for detecting, locating, or tracking objects, and for measuring altitudes.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: light support
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: supporting a light

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: microwave
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: broadcasting and receiving signals using microwaves.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cooling
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: dissipating heat.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: observation
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a place from which the surroundings can be observed but at which a watch is not habitually maintained.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: time ball
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a visual time signal in form of a ball

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: clock
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: visual time signal.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: control
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: used to control the flow of air, rail, or marine traffic.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: airship mooring
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a facility to secure an airship.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: stadium
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a large usually unroofed building with tiers of seats for spectators

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bus station
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a location at which buses arrive and from which they depart.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Height
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The value of the vertical distance to the highest point of the object, measured from a specified vertical datum.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: Height must not be used for floating objects. The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal accuracy
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the horizontal accuracy of horizontal clearance and distances.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The expected input is the radius of the two-dimensional error. The error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character shall not be encoded. The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft. (Superseded S-57 attribute.)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal distance uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the horizontal accuracy of horizontal clearances and distances.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: the error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character must not be encoded.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal length
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A measurement of the longer of two linear axis.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal position uncertainty
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a position.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The expected input is the maximum of the two-dimensional error. The error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character shall not be encoded.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Horizontal width
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A measurement of the shorter of two linear axis.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: ID Code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Identification code as specified in predefined system. Also called identification number.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Information
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Textual information about the object

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Information in national language
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Textual information in national language characters
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The attribute 'information in national language' encodes any textual information about an object using a specified national language. The textual information could be, for example, a list, a table or a text. This attribute should be used, for example, to hold the information that is shown on paper charts by cautionary and explanatory notes.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Inspection frequency
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement of how frequently an item is inspected

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Inspection requirements
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A statement of what requirements are in place for how inspection of an item is carried out

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Installation date
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The date when an item was installed

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Light characteristic
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The typical behaviour associated with the light
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: A selection of the above characteristics is defined and illustrated diagrammatically in IHO Chart Specifications, M-4, 471.2.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fixed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal light that shows continuously, in any given direction, with constant luminous intensity and colour.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: flashing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a rhythmic light in which the total duration of light in a period is clearly shorter than the total duration of darkness and all the appearances of light are of equal duration.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: long-flashing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a flashing light in which a single flash of not less than two seconds duration is regularly repeated.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: quick-flashing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light exhibiting without interruption very rapid regular alternations of light and darkness.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: very quick flashing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a flashing light in which flashes are repeated at a rate of not less than 80 flashes per minute but less than 160 flashes per minute.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ultra quick flashing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a flashing light in which flashes are repeated at a rate of not less than 160 flashes per minute.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: isophased
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light with all durations of light and darkness equal.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: occulting
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a rhythmic light in which the total duration of light in a period is clearly longer than the total duration of darkness and all the eclipses are of equal duration.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: interrupted quick flashing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a quick light in which the sequence of flashes is interrupted by regularly repeated eclipses of constant and long duration.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: interrupted very quick flashing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light in which the very rapid alterations of light and darkness are interrupted at regular intervals by eclipses of long duration.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: interrupted ultra quick flashing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light in which the ultra quick flashes (160 or more per minute) are interrupted at regular intervals by eclipses of long duration.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: morse
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a rhythmic light in which appearances of light of two clearly different durations are grouped to represent a character or characters in the Morse code.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fixed/flash
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a rhythmic light in which a fixed light is combined with a flashing light of higher luminous intensity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: flash/long-flash
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Not defined in the GI Registry as of Dec. 2016)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: occulting/flash
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Not defined in the GI Registry as of Dec. 2016)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fixed/long-flash
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Not defined in the GI Registry as of Dec. 2016)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: occulting alternating
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Not defined in the GI Registry as of Dec. 2016)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: long-flash alternating
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Not defined in the GI Registry as of Dec. 2016)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: flash alternating
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Not defined in the GI Registry as of Dec. 2016)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: quick-flash plus long-flash
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Not defined in the GI Registry as of Dec. 2016)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: very quick-flash plus long-flash
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Not defined in the GI Registry as of Dec. 2016)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ultra quick-flash plus long-flash
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Not defined in the GI Registry as of Dec. 2016)

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: alternating
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a signal light that shows, in any given direction, two or more colours in a regularly repeated sequence with a regular periodicity.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fixed and alternating flashing
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:remarks: (Not defined in the GI Registry as of Dec. 2016)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Light visibility
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The specific visibility of a light, with respect to the light's intensity and ease of recognition.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: "light visibility" encodes the specific visibility of a light, with respect to the light's intensity and ease of recognition.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: high intensity
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: non-marine lights with a higher power than marine lights and visible from well off shore (often 'Aero' lights).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: low intensity
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: non-marine lights with lower power than marine lights.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: faint
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a decrease in the apparent intensity of a light which may occur in the case of partial obstructions.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: intensified
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light in a sector is intensified (i.e. has longer range than other sectors).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unintensified
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light in a sector is unintensified (i.e. has shorter range than other sectors).

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: visibility deliberately restricted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a light sector is deliberately reduced in intensity, for example to reduce its effect on a built-up area.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: obscured
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: said of the arc of a light sector designated by its limiting bearings in which the light is not visible from seaward.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: partially obscured
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: this value specifies that parts of the sector are obscured.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: visible in line of range
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: lights that must be in line to be visible.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Manned structure
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An expression of the feature being permanently manned or not.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Marks navigational - System of
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The system of navigational buoyage a region complies with.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IALA A
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: navigational aids conform to the International Association of Lighthouse Authorities - IALA A system.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: IALA B
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: navigational aids conform to the International Association of Lighthouse Authorities - IALA B system.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: no system
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: navigational aids do not conform to any defined system.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: other system
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: navigational aids conform to a defined system other than International Association of Lighthouse Authorities -IALA.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fixed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Fixed Topmark

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: floating
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Floating Topmark

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Maximum display scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The largest intended viewing scale for the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Minimum display scale
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The smallest intended viewing scale for the data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Multiplicity of lights
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The number of lights of identical character that exist as a co-located group.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Nature of construction
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The buildings primary construction material
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: NOTE: IALA added listed values, codes must be verified after GI registry approval

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: masonry
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: constructed of brick or stone.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: concreted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: constructed of concrete, a material made of sand and gravel that is united by cement into a hardened mass used for roads, foundations, etc.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: loose boulders
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: constructed from large stones or blocks of concrete, often placed loosely for protection against waves or water turbulence.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: hard surface
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: constructed with a surface of hard material, usually a term applied to roads surfaced with asphalt or concrete.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unsurfaced
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: constructed with no extra protection, usually a term applied to roads not surfaced with a hard material.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: wooden
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: constructed from wood.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: metal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: constructed from metal.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: glass reinforced plastic (GRP)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: constructed from a plastic material strengthened with fibres of glass.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: painted
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the application of paint to some other construction or natural feature.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: fiberglass
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Constructed from fiberglass

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: plastic
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: Constructed from plastic

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Object name
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The individual name of an object.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Object name in national language
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Name of object in national language characters.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The attribute 'object name in national language' encodes the individual name of an object in the specified national language.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Orientation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The angular distance measured from true north to the major axis of the object.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: This is a superseded S-57 attribute.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Periodic date end
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The end of the active period for a seasonal object (e.g., a buoy).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: See also 'date end' (DATEND).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Periodic date start
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The start of the active period for a seasonal object (e.g., a buoy).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: See also 'date start' (DATSTA).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Pictorial representation
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Indicates whether a pictorial representation of the object is available.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The 'pictorial representation' could be a drawing or a photo. The string encodes the file name of an external graphic file (pixel/vector).

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Positional accuracy
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a position.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The expected input is the maximum of the two-dimensional error. The error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character shall not be encoded. (Superseded S-57 attribute.)

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Postal code
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Known in various countries as a postcode, or ZIP code, the postal code is a series of letters and/or digits that identifies each postal delivery area.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Product
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The various substances which are transported, stored or exploited.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: oil
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a thick, slippery liquid that will not dissolve in water, usually petroleum based in the context of storage tanks.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: gas
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a substance with particles that can move freely, usually a fuel substance in the context of storage tanks.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a colourless, odourless, tasteless liquid that is a compound of hydrogen and oxygen.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: stone
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a general term for rock fragments.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: coal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a hard black mineral that is burned as fuel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: ore
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a solid rock or mineral from which metal is obtained.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: chemicals
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: any substance obtained by or used in a chemical process.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: drinking water
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: water that is suitable for human consumption.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: milk
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a white fluid secreted by female mammals as food for their young.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: bauxite
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a mineral from which aluminum is obtained.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: coke
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a solid substance obtained after gas and tar have been extracted from coal, used as a fuel.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: iron ingots
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an oblong lump of cast iron metal.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: salt
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: sodium chloride obtained from mines or by the evaporation of sea water.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: sand
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: tiny grains of crushed or worn rock.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: timber
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: wood prepared for use in building or carpentry.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: sawdust/wood chips
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: powdery fragments of wood made in sawing timber or coarse chips produced for use in manufacturing pressed board.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: scrap metal
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: discarded metal suitable for being reprocessed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: liquified natural gas (LNG)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a compressed gas consisting of flammable light hydrocarbons and derived from natural gas.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: liquified petroleum gas (LPG)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a compressed gas consisting of flammable light hydrocarbons and derived from petroleum.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: wine
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the fermanted juice of grapes.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: cement
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a substance made of powdered lime and clay, mixed with water.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: grain
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a small hard seed, especially that of any cereal plant such as wheat, rice, corn, rye etc.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Quality of position
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The degree of reliability attributed to a position

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: surveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the position(s) was(were) determined by the operation of making measurements for determining the relative position of points on, above or beneath the earth's surface. Survey implies a regular, controlled survey of any date.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unsurveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: survey data is does not exist or is very poor.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: inadequately surveyed
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: position data is of a very poor quality.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: approximate
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a position that is considered to be less than third-order accuracy, but is generally considered to be within 30.5 metres of its correct geographic location. Also may apply to an object whose position does not remain fixed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: position doubtful
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object whose position has been reported but which is considered to be doubtful.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unreliable
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object's position obtained from questionable or unreliable data.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reported (not surveyed)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object whose position has been reported and its position confirmed by some means other than a formal survey such as an independent report of the same object.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: reported (not confirmed)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object whose position has been reported and its position has not been confirmed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: estimated
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the most probable position of an object determined from incomplete data or data of questionable accuracy.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: precisely known
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a position that is of a known value, such as the position of an anchor berth or other defined object.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: calculated
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a position that is computed from data.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Quality of sounding measurement
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The reliability of the value of a sounding.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: depth known
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the depth from chart datum to the bottom is a known value.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: depth or least depth unknown
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the depth from chart datum to the bottom is unknown.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: doubtful sounding
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a depth that may be less than indicated.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: unreliable sounding
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: a depth that is considered to be an unreliable value.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: no bottom found at value shown
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: upon investigation the bottom was not found at this depth.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: least depth known
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the shoalest depth over a feature is of known value.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: least depth unknown, safe clearance at depth shown
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the least depth over a feature is unknown, but there is considered to be safe clearance at this depth.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: value reported (not surveyed)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: depth value obtained from a report, but not fully surveyed.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: value reported (not confirmed)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: depth value obtained from a report, which it has not been possible to confirm.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: maintained depth
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: the depth at which a channel is kept by human influence, usually by dredging.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not regularly maintained
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: depths may be altered by human influence, but will not be routinely maintained.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Radar conspicuous
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: A feature which returns a strong radar echo.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: radar conspicuous
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object which returns a strong radar echo.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: not radar conspicuous
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object which does not return a particularly strong radar echo.

S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:label: radar conspicuous (has radar reflector)
S100FC:listedValue.S100FC:definition: an object which returns a strong radar echo, having a radar reflector.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Radar wave length
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The distance between two successive peaks (or other points of identical phase) on an electromagnetic wave in the radar band of the electromagnetic spectrum.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The attribute 'radar transponder beacon wavelength' encodes the specific wavelength at which a radar transponder beacon transmits. Radar transponder beacons generally work on the following wavelengths: 3cm (X) Band, 10cm (S) Band. Nevertheless, wavelengths outside the marine band are used.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Remote monitoring system
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: Classification or name of system used to remotely monitor a feature

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Remotely monitored
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: An expression of a feature being remotely monitored or not.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Scale minimum
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The minimum scale at which the object may be used, e.g., for ECDIS presentation.
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: The modulus of the scale is indicated, that is 1:1 250 000 is encoded as 1250000.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Sector limit one
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The sector limit 1 specifies the first limit of the sector. The order of sector limit 1 and sector limit 2 is clockwise around the central object (e.g., a light).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: A sector is the part of a circle between two straight lines drawn from the centre to the circumference (Advanced Learner's Dictionary, 2nd Edition). The values given to the common limits of adjacent sectors should be identical. The orientation of bearing is from seaward to the central object. This conforms with the method used in 'List of Lights' publications. A generic term such as 'to shore' cannot be used; a specific bearing must be encoded. Where a light sector limit is defined as 'to the shore', it should be encoded using a value that ensures that, when the limit is drawn, it will fall entirely on land.

S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:name: Sector limit two
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:definition: The sector limit 2 specifies the second limit of the sector. The order of sector limit 1 and sector limit 2 is clockwise around the central object (e.g., a light).
S100FC:S100_FC_SimpleAttribute.S100FC:remarks: A sector is the part of a circle between two straight lines drawn from the centre to the circumference (Advanced Learner's Dictionary, 2nd Edition). The values given to the common limits of adjacent sectors should be identical. The orientation of bearing is from seaward to the central object.
